enigmacodes wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> How can I tweak heritrix to crawl only within a seed?
> E.g. if my seed is www.espn.com, I would like to retrieve/download only links within espn.com. I understand Heritrix by default will persue all links it finds (including external ones).
> 
> I am using Heritrix 2.0.0

If you're just starting with Heritrix, we recommend using 1.14.3.

With the default configuration, crawling will generally stay on the 
sites defined by the seeds, but the crawler will go offsite to get URLs 
that appear necessary to render on-site pages (such as embedded images, 
scripts, stylesheets, etc.). This behavior comes from the 
'TransclusionDecideRule' -- so removing that rule or setting its various 
'*-hops' limits to zero will prevent the offsite collection.

On the other hand, if you do want necessary offsite resources, but find 
Heritrix sometimes going too many hops off, you could reduce those 
TransclusionDecideRule '*-hops' values without moving them to zero. 
Also, Heritrix always considers links found in Javascript or Flash to be 
like inline/embedded resources (because it can't tell the difference 
between those that load into the page, or only load on user navigation). 
So if you find the only reason Heritrix is wandering offsite is such 
links, you could disable Javascript extraction (in the ExtractorHTML and 
ExtractorJS) and Flash extraction (in ExtractorSWF).
